dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3979 RH: Keep America’s Refuges Operational Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Jeffries (for himself, Mr. Wittman, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. Graves of Louisiana, Mr. Sablan, Mr. LoBiondo, and Mr. Thompson of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

Additional sponsors: Mr. Kind, Mr. Westerman, Mrs. Radewagen, Mr. Collins of Georgia, Mr. Tipton, Mr. Pearce, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Johnson of Louisiana, Mr. Jody B. Hice of Georgia, Mr. Curbelo of Florida, and Ms. Bordallo
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on October 5, 2017

form.official-title: To amend the Fish and Wildlife Act of 1956 to reauthorize the volunteer services, community partnership, and refuge education programs of the National Wildlife Refuge System, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Keep America’s Refuges Operational Act.

section.header: Reauthorization of National Wildlife Refuge System volunteer services, community partnership, and refuge education programs
section.text: Section 7 of the Fish and Wildlife Act of 1956 (16 U.S.C. 742f) is amended in subsection (g), by striking 2011 through 2014 and inserting 2018 through 2022.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
